unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Sports Drinks: Null and Alternative Hypotheses
question_text: Suppose a random survey was taken in a large urban high school to determine if vending machine location affects whether sports drinks are more likely to be ordered. A large single sample of size n = $500$ was taken over the last week. In the cafeteria, $78$ of the $165$ drinks purchased were sports drinks. In the gym, $98$ of the $157$ drinks purchased were sports drinks, and in the auditorium, $54$ of the $178$ drinks purchased were sports drinks. What are the appropriate null and alternative hypotheses?

choices.text: H o : H o : There is no relationship between location and preferring sports drink H a : H a : A higher proportion of drinks purchased in the gym are sports drinks
H o : H o : Location and preferring a sports drink are not independent H a : H a : Location and preferring a sports drink are independent
H o : H o : No association exists between location and preferring a sports drink H a : H a : An association exists between location and preferring a sports drink
H o : H o : There is no relationship between the number of sports drinks ordered at each location H a : H a : There is a relation between the number of sports drinks ordered at each location
H o : H o : Sports drinks and preference are homogeneous H a : H a : Sports drinks and preference are not homogeneous
